results.title: The Invader
results.creator_credit: Potomac Film Producers and George C. Stoney
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the disease Syphilis, its effects, attempted cures, the discovery of its scientific diagnosis, its early treatment with Salvarsan and later with Penicillin as well as attempts to educate the public to make use of clinics to break the chain of infection.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Potomac Film Producers and George C. Stoney

results.title: The Intruders: cockroaches
results.brief_description: Illustrates the life cycle of the cockroach. Follows development from the time the egg is laid by the female to the adult insect. Also touches on methods of controlling this pest Narrated by James McKechnie.

results.title: The Interview, the 180 rule
results.creator_credit: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Video tech”.
This program focusses on the television interview. It analyses camera position, the use of light, shot composition, and also the questions - what to ask, when to ask and how to ask! It also includes other important points to remember, such as backcuts, noddies and not crossing the line.

results.title: The Interview
results.brief_description: An animated satire by Ernest Pintoff presenting an interview between a ‘square’ pseudo-intellectual announcer and a ‘hip’jazz musician. The announcer is utterly confused by the musician’s terminology, and the latter is utterly discouraged by the announcer’s ignorance.

results.title: The International Telecommunication Union
results.creator_credit: Ramakantha Sarma, Krishna Singh and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
The conquest of time and distance in communications is one of the miracles of the modern age. Records the technological advances and growing co-operation among nations from the early pioneers to the latest spacecommunication satellites. The role of the International Telecommunication Union is emphasised particularly in the developing countries.

results.title: The International Court of Justice
results.creator_credit: Janine Hamel-Minne, United Nations. Office of Public Information and Karl Van der Ploeg
results.brief_description: The origin of the concept of international law and the evolvement of the role of the International Court of Justice in the Hague, in deciding legal disputes between States. Its work and function are illustrated in the controversy between Norway and the United Kingdom concerning fishing rights, the disputed frontier land between Belgium and the Netherlands, and the dispute between Cambodia and Thailand regarding the territorial sovereignty of a holy monastery.

results.title: The Interference of photons
results.creator_credit: Physical Sciences Study Committee and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Presents an experiment at MIT in which light exhibits both particle and wave characteristics. Characteristic interference pattern is pointed out by many individual photons hitting at places consistent with the interference pattern.

results.title: The Intelligent animal
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
One of a series of films using resources not available in the classroom. This is the introductory film to the series, and is a general outline of human anatomy and physiology.
